pullRequest.title: Extend tracing with provsion to accept message and error as arguments
pullRequest.bodyText:
During the implementation of mongodb based device registry, I came across the below tracing helper methods that takes either a message or an error as an argument.
logError(final Span span, final String message)
logError(final Span span, final Throwable error)

In some cases, I prefer to log both the custom message and also the thrown exception. Hence as part of this PR, I have added the below method that takes both message and error as arguments and then logs them.
logError(final Span span, final String message, final Throwable error)

nodes.bodyText: wouldn't it make more sense to allow any one of them to be null and then just log the non-null argument?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -159,6 +159,28 @@ public static void logError(final Span span, final String message) { } } + /** + * Marks an OpenTracing span as erroneous, logs a message and an error. + *

+ * This method does not finish the span. + * + * @param span The span to mark. + * @param message The message to log on the span. + * @param error The error to log on the span. + * @throws NullPointerException if message or error is {@code null}.

commit.message:
Improve tracing by adding a method that accepts message and error as arguments and logs them.

Signed-off-by: Kartheeswaran Kalidass <kartheeswaran.kalidass@bosch.io>
